message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.CR, cs.SD 

This paper focuses on analyzing the linguistic components of blogposts collected from a Chinese microblogging platform, which falls under the scope of natural language processing (NLP) and computational linguistics (CL). Therefore, cs.CL is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves building a classifier to predict censorship, which falls under the scope of machine learning and data mining (cs.SI). Additionally, the paper discusses the Collective Action Potential (CAP) theory, which is related to social dynamics and network analysis (cs.CY). The paper also touches upon censorship and privacy (cs.CR) and social and information networks (cs.SD).
